abstract: Intel said that it had chosen to withdraw from the One Laptop Per Child educational computer organization due to what a spokesman called “philosophical” differences.
snippet: Intel said that it had chosen to withdraw from the One Laptop Per Child educational computer organization due to what a spokesman called “philosophical” differences.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Intel said Thursday that it had chosen to withdraw from the One Laptop Per Child educational computer organization, which it joined in July after years of public squabbling between Intel’s chairman, Craig R. Barrett, and the group’s founder, Nicholas P. Negroponte.

headline.main: Intel Leaves Group Backing Education PCs
headline.print_headline: Intel Leaves Group Backing Education PCs
